info.question: What does Amazon SWF stand for?
What does Amazon SES stand for?
What happens when you create a topic on Amazon SNS?
answers: The topic will terminate your EC2 instances without a tag.
You can create a topic on Amazon SQS not on SNS.
You cannot create a topic on SNS.
An Amazon Resource Name is created
correctAnswer: An Amazon Resource Name is created

info.question: What is the difference between SNS and SQS?
answers: SQS sends messages to people on topics, where as SNS manages tasks
SNS pulls (polls) where as SQS is push based message service
SQS and SNS are basically the same service
SNS is push notification service, where as SQS is message system that requires worker nodes to poll the queue.
correctAnswer: SNS is push notification service, where as SQS is message system that requires worker nodes to poll the queue.

info.question: What application service allows you to decouple your infrastructure using messaged based queues?
What does a 'domain' refer to in Amazon SWF?
answers: A security group in which only tasks inside can initiate
The DNS record for the Amazon SWF service

info.question: By default, EC2 instances pull SQS messages from an SQS queue on a FIFO (First In First out) basis.
Amazon's SQS service guarantees a message will be delivered at least once.
Amazon SWF ensures that a task is assigned only once and is never duplicated.
Amazon SWF restrict me to use specific programming languages.
SQS is a ________ based system component
SNS is a ________ based system component
Which AWS service allows you to decouple the components of your application?
Which type of distributed application components can store a message in an SQS queue?
SQS messages can contain up to _____ of text in ________ format?
Any distributed application component can retrieve messages programatically from the queue using _________?
How does SQS help in your distributed system design?
answers: it allows for the situation when the message producing component is producing work faster than the message consuming component can process the messages
when your message producing component and/or your message consuming component are intermittently available (when you're using spot instances, for example)
it allows you to push messages to many receiving components through topics
it allows you to create workflows with directors and workers
you can use auto-scaling groups to monitor messages in your queue, and scale up or down your processing app EC2 instances if the queue gets too full or drains down to very low
correctAnswer: it allows for the situation when the message producing component is producing work faster than the message consuming component can process the messages
when your message producing component and/or your message consuming component are intermittently available (when you're using spot instances, for example)
you can use auto-scaling groups to monitor messages in your queue, and scale up or down your processing app EC2 instances if the queue gets too full or drains down to very low

info.question: What are the two types of SQS queues?
Which SQS queue type is the default type?
How many transactions per second can the SQS standard queue handle?
SQS standard queues guarantee that _________?
answers: a message is delivered at least once
correctAnswer: a message is delivered at least once

info.question: SQS standard queues offer _________?
SQS standard queue best-effort ordering ensures __________?
answers: that messages are generally delivered in the same order they are sent
that messages are in the same order they are sent
that messages are in the random order
correctAnswer: that messages are generally delivered in the same order they are sent

info.question: SQS FIFO queues offer __________?
answers: first-in-first-out delivery and exactly once processing
first-in-first-out delivery and usually once processing
first-out-first-in delivery and exactly once processing
correctAnswer: first-in-first-out delivery and exactly once processing

info.question: With SQS FIFO queues, the order in which ____________ is strictly preserved?
answers: the messages are sent and received
correctAnswer: the messages are sent and received

info.question: With SQS FIFO queues, the message is delivered ________?
With SQS FIFO queues, the message remains available until ________?
answers: a consumer processes and deletes it
correctAnswer: a consumer processes and deletes it

info.question: With SQS FIFO queues ________?
answers: duplicates are not introduced into the queue
duplicates are allows into the queue
multiples are allowed into the queue
correctAnswer: duplicates are not introduced into the queue

info.question: Which SQS queue type offers message groups?
SQS message groups allow ________?
answers: multiple ordered message groups within a single queue
multiple ordered message groups within multiple queues
a single ordered message group within a single queue
a single ordered message group within multiple queues
correctAnswer: multiple ordered message groups within a single queue

info.question: SQS FIFO queues are limited to how many transactions per second?
With SQS, messages can be kept in the queue for how long?
With SQS, the default time a message can be kept in the queue is _________?
With SQS, the visibility timeout is _______?
answers: the amount of time that the message is invisible in the SQS queue after a consumer picks up that message
the amount of time that the message is visible in the queue
the amount of time before the message is visible
the amount of time the message is visible
correctAnswer: the amount of time that the message is invisible in the SQS queue after a consumer picks up that message

info.question: With the SQS visibility timeout, provided that the job is processed before the visibility timeout expires, the message will then be ________?
answers: moved to the dead letter queue
moved to the fron of the queue
moved to the end of the queue

info.question: With the SQS visibility timeout, if the job is not processed before the visibility timeout expires, the message will then ________?
answers: moved to the dead letter queue
moved to the fron of the queue
moved to the end of the queue

info.question: With the SQS visibility timeout, if the job is not processed before the visibility timeout expires, the message will then become visible again. This could result in ________?
answers: the same message being delivered twice
the message being moved to the dead letter queue
the message beingmoved to the fron of the queue
the message beingmoved to the end of the queue
correctAnswer: the same message being delivered twice

info.question: The SQS visibility timeout maximum is ______
SQS guarantees that _________
answers: your messages will be delivered at least once
correctAnswer: your messages will be delivered at least once

info.question: What are the two types of SQS polling?
With SQS long polling, your polling call doesn't return until ________?
answers: a message arrives in the queue
the long poll call times out
the long poll call is interrupted
correctAnswer: a message arrives in the queue
the long poll call times out

info.question: With SQS short polling, your polling call _________?
answers: returns immediately, even if the queue being polled is empty
returns after a set timeout, even if the queue being polled is empty
returns immediately, and gives a warning if the queue is empty
correctAnswer: returns immediately, even if the queue being polled is empty

info.question: SWF is __________?
answers: a web service that coordinates work across distributed application components and even manual tasks
a web service that coordinates work across distributed application components but not manual tasks
a web service that queues work across distributed application components
correctAnswer: a web service that coordinates work across distributed application components and even manual tasks

info.question: What are some of the use cases for SWF?
SWF use cases are designed as _________?
SWF tasks represent invocations of various processing steps in an application which can be performed by _________?
SWF workers are ________?
SWF workers do which of these?
answers: return the results of a processed task
correctAnswer: return the results of a processed task

info.question: SWF deciders are ________?
answers: a program that controls the coordination of tasks
a program that schedules the tasks
a human worker that controls the coordination of tasks
a human worker that schedules the tasks
correctAnswer: a program that controls the coordination of tasks

info.question: In SWF which of these is an application that can initiate a workflow?
In SWF, which of these are examples of workflow starters?
In SWF, workers and the decider can run on cloud infrastrucute such as _________?
SWF _______ between workers and the decider?
SWF ensures that a task is ___________?
answers: assigned only once and is never duplicated
assigned and sometimes can be duplicated
correctAnswer: assigned only once and is never duplicated

info.question: What is the key difference between SQS and SWF?
answers: SQS can have duplicated tasks but SWF will never duplicate a task
SWF can have duplicated tasks but SQS will never duplicate a task
SWF is queue based and SQS is workflow based
SWF is fault tolerant but SQS is not
correctAnswer: SQS can have duplicated tasks but SWF will never duplicate a task

info.question: SWF can scale quickly because _________?
answers: SWF maintains the application's state durably, so workers and deciders don't have to keep track of execution state
SWF is distributed across all of your AZs
correctAnswer: SWF maintains the application's state durably, so workers and deciders don't have to keep track of execution state

info.question: SWF workflows, activity types, and the workflow execution itself are scoped to a _______?
SWF workflow domains isolate a set of types, executions, and task lists from  others within the same _______?
You can register an SWF domain by ________?
answers: using the RegisterDomain action in the SWF API
correctAnswer: using the RegisterDomain action in the SWF API

info.question: SWF domain parameters are specified in _______ format?
The maximum an SWF workflow can run is _________?
SWF workflows are measured in _________?
Which of these offers a task-oriented API?
Which of these offers a message-oriented API?
With which of these do you not need to keep track of all tasks and events in an application because the service does it for you?
With which of these do you need to implement your own application-level tracking especially if your application uses multiple queues?
With which of these is a web service that allows you to set up, operate, and send notifications from the cloud?

Which of these provides developers with a highly scalable, flexible, and cost effective capability to push messages from an application and immediately deliver them to subscribers or other applications?
Besides pushing notifications directly to mobile devices, SNS can also deliver notifications via SMS text message or email to which of these?
SNS notifications can trigger lambda functions?
When a message is published to an SNS topic that has a lambda function subscribed to it, the lambda function in invoked with the payload of _______?
SNS allows you to group multiple recipients using ______?
With SNS, one topic can support deliveries to __________?
To prevent messages from being loast, all messages published to SNS are stored redundantly across ________?
With SNS you have no up-front costs and a pay-as-you-go pricing model?
Which service is a media transcoder in the cloud
Which service is a fully managed service that makes it easy for developers to publish, maintain, monitor, and secure APIs at any scale
You can enable _____ in API Gateway to cache your endpoint's response
When you enable API caching, API Gateway caches responses from your end-point for a specified _______ period in _______
With API Gateway you can _______
answers: throttle requests to prevent DDoS attacks
connect to CloudWatch to log all requests
have human tasks as steps in your process
correctAnswer: throttle requests to prevent DDoS attacks
connect to CloudWatch to log all requests

info.question: Under this policy, a web browser permits scripts contained in a first web page to access data in a second web page, but only if they both have the same origin, meaning they have the same domain name
______ is a way the server at the other end can relax the same origin policy
When you see 'Error - 'Origin policy cannont be read at the remote resource', you need to _________
answers: Switch to something other than API Gateway

info.question: What is the AWS service to which you can send your streaming data?
What are the three Kinesis services?
Which of the three Kinesis services stores data in shards?
Which of the three Kinesis services allows you to analyze the data sent through it using lambda functions in real-time?

Which of the three Kinesis services allows you to analyze the data sent through it using lambda functions in real-time and then send the analyzed data to S3 or ElasticSearch clusters. After the data goes to S3 or ElasticSearch it can then be copied to Redshift?
If your job runs for greater than 12 hours, which service should you not use because its visibility timeout maximum is 12 hours?

When using CloudFront, how can you guard your content from being served without your application serving it up?
answers: use restricted urls via ip blocking in Security Groups
use restricted urls via ip blocking in your NACLs

info.question: When using Auto-Scaling Groups, you must first create a _________ to describe the instances to launch?
When using Auto-Scaling Groups, you _______ to launch your instances?
